DataElement.preferredName: Breast Primary Surgical Procedure Performed Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a description of the most extensive surgical technique performed as primary treatment for breast cancer.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to the first or most extensive operative procedure performed as curative treatment for a malignant tumor of one of the two hemispheric organs on the chest over the pectoralis major muscle.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:Occurring first in time or sequence; original. (American Heritage Dictionary):Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.
Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: revised to use standard term "surgical procedure"

ValueDomain.preferredName: Breast Primary Surgical Procedure Performed Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a description of the most extensive surgical technique performed as treatment for breast cancer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of the breast.: Not characterized in any other way.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of the breast.
Not characterized in any other way.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: PARTIAL MASTECTOMY, LUMPECTOMY OR EXCISIONAL BIOPSY

ValueMeaning.preferredName: PARTIAL MASTECTOMY, LUMPECTOMY OR EXCISIONAL BIOPSY
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The removal of a cancer as well as some of the breast tissue around the tumor and the lining over the chest muscles below the tumor. Usually some of the lymph nodes under the arm are also taken out.  Also called segmental mastectomy.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a discrete mass.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 8/12/22 added alt VM for Alliance cjl;

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery to remove abnormal tissue or cancer from the breast and a small amount of normal tissue around it. It is a type of breast-sparing surgery.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a discrete mass.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Resection of a segment of an organ or partial resection of a gland.

Concepts.definition: Resection of a segment of an organ or partial resection of a gland.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery to remove abnormal tissue or cancer from the breast and a small amount of normal tissue around it. It is a type of breast-sparing surgery.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a discrete mass.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 01/29/2015.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: MODIFIED RADICAL MASTECTOMY

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of one or both breasts, including the areola, nipple, and the majority of the axillary lymph nodes, but sparing the pectoralis major muscle.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Removal of the breast, pectoral muscles, axillary lymph nodes, and associated skin and subcutaneous tissue (from MeSH).

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of one or both breasts, including the areola, nipple, axillary lymph nodes, and pectoral muscles.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery for breast cancer in which the breast, most or all of the lymph nodes under the arm, and the lining over the chest muscles are removed. Sometimes the surgeon also removes part of the chest wall muscles.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of one or both breasts, including the areola, nipple, and the majority of the axillary lymph nodes, but sparing the pectoralis major muscle.

PermissibleValues.value: Skin sparing or nipple sparing mastectomy

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The pigmented projection on the surface of the breast. Ducts that conduct milk from the mammary glands to the surface of the breast exit through the nipple. (from MedTerms Medical Dictionary; medterms.com): An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Removal of the breast tissue, nipple, areola, and original biopsy scar, but not the breast skin.

Concepts.definition: The pigmented protuberance on the surface of the breast through which milk is drawn from the breast.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Removal of the breast tissue, nipple, areola, and original biopsy scar, but not the breast skin.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Removal of only the breast tissue and nipple and a small portion of the overlying skin.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure involving the removal of the entire breast tissue, nipple and a portion of the overlying skin, while leaving the axillary contents intact.

PermissibleValues.value: Partial or segmental mastectomy or quadrantectomy
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lumpectomy Or Segmental Mastectomy Or Quadrantectomy

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lumpectomy Or Segmental Mastectomy Or Quadrantectomy
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The removal of a cancer as well as some of the breast tissue around the tumor and the lining over the chest muscles below the tumor. Usually some of the lymph nodes under the arm are also taken out.  Also called segmental mastectomy.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: The removal of a cancer as well as some of the breast tissue around the tumor and the lining over the chest muscles below the tumor. Usually some of the lymph nodes under the arm are also taken out. Also called partial mastectomy. (Cancer.gov): An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Surgical removal of the region of the breast (approximately one quarter) containing cancer.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a discrete mass.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

The removal of a cancer as well as some of the breast tissue around the tumor and the lining over the chest muscles below the tumor. Usually some of the lymph nodes under the arm are also taken out. Also called partial mastectomy. (Cancer.gov)

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The surgical removal of one quarter of the tissue in a breast tissue, including ipsilateral chest wall muscles within a given margin of the tumor.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Mastectomy (simple or skin sparing or modified radical or radical)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of the breast.

PermissibleValues.value: Breast conserving surgery (partial/segmental mastectomy or lumpectomy)
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast conserving surgery (partial/segmental mastectomy or lumpectomy)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast conserving surgery (partial/segmental mastectomy or lumpectomy)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast conservation treatment is defined as excision of the primary tumor and adjacent breast tissue, followed by radiation therapy.  This procedure is also referred to as lumpectomy, segmental mastectomy, or partial mastectomy. (from Consensus Statements: Treatment of Early-stage Breast Cancer, 1990)

Concepts.definition: Breast conservation treatment is defined as excision of the primary tumor and adjacent breast tissue, followed by radiation therapy.  This procedure is also referred to as lumpectomy, segmental mastectomy, or partial mastectomy. (from Consensus Statements: Treatment of Early-stage Breast Cancer, 1990)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast conservation treatment is defined as excision of the primary tumor and adjacent breast tissue, followed by radiation therapy.  This procedure is also referred to as lumpectomy, segmental mastectomy, or partial mastectomy. (from Consensus Statements: Treatment of Early-stage Breast Cancer, 1990): Surgery performed to reduce the size of the breast.

Concepts.definition: Breast conservation treatment is defined as excision of the primary tumor and adjacent breast tissue, followed by radiation therapy.  This procedure is also referred to as lumpectomy, segmental mastectomy, or partial mastectomy. (from Consensus Statements: Treatment of Early-stage Breast Cancer, 1990)
Surgery performed to reduce the size of the breast.

PermissibleValues.value: Unilateral mastectomy with free flap recon
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Unilateral Mastectomy With Free Tissue Transfer Flap Surgical Reconstruction

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Unilateral Mastectomy With Free Tissue Transfer Flap Surgical Reconstruction
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Involving only one part or side.: Surgical removal of the breast.: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.: The transplantation of autologous tissue that is completely detached from its original blood supply from one location to another using microvascular reconstruction techniques to reestablish circulation.: The surgical transfer of tissue from one site to another while maintaining its own blood supply.

Concepts.definition: Involving only one part or side.
Surgical removal of the breast.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.

The transplantation of autologous tissue that is completely detached from its original blood supply from one location to another using microvascular reconstruction techniques to reestablish circulation.
The surgical transfer of tissue from one site to another while maintaining its own blood supply.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Involving only one part or side.: Surgical removal of the breast.: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: Surgical reconstruction of the breast.

Concepts.definition: Involving only one part or side.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Unilateral Mastectomy With Breast Tissue Expander Breast Implant

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Unilateral Mastectomy With Breast Tissue Expander Breast Implant
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Involving only one part or side.: Surgical removal of the breast.: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.: An inflatable reservoir that is used to expand the remaining breast skin after a mastectomy and prior to surgical reconstruction.: A silicone gel-filled or saline-filled sac placed under the chest muscle to restore breast shape.

Concepts.definition: Involving only one part or side.
Surgical removal of the breast.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
An inflatable reservoir that is used to expand the remaining breast skin after a mastectomy and prior to surgical reconstruction.
A silicone gel-filled or saline-filled sac placed under the chest muscle to restore breast shape.
